Vartkes is 36 years old. He is divorced and lives in the small village of Damia with his retired mother and a brother. The family members run a small dairy farm with two calves and a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. Vartkes sells the cheese products locally. 

He requested a loan start up a family agricultural business. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Vartkes will rent 2 ha of agricultural land and sow maize and sunflower there. The family members will do all of the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good quality harvest. The harvested products will be sold at the local open market and this will increase the family income. They will be able to combat their poverty, and in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available from the country’s capital market as needed.

loans.use: to rent agricultural land and sow sunflower and maize

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón vive junto y su compañera de vida en casa de su propiedad, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener siempre la mejores cosechas, el terreno esta en un lugar accesible apto para el cultivo y con suelo fértil, todo lo que produce lo comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además se caracteriza por tener el mejor servicio; Ramón es un hombre decidido, responsable y muy trabajador, tiene muchas metas para el futuro y con empeño y constancia piensa alcanzarlas, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le s solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  semilla de maíz, frijol, herbicida, abono, herramienta, etc. Ramón tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, se siente contenta con la ayuda y asegura poder saldar la deuda, a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Ramón lives with his life partner in his own home. He works growing corn and beans. He has been working several years in agriculture and has gotten a lot of valuable experience that permits him to always obtain the best crops. The land is in an accessible location and suitable for farming and with fertile soil. He sells everything he grows in the surrounding areas of the community. He has many clients as they know that everything he sells is good quality and at good prices and also he is known for having the best service.

Ramón is a determined man, responsible and hard working. He has many goals for the future and has the commitment and tenacity to reach them. Last growing season he had some losses and he wants to recover but does not have sufficient capital so he is asking Integral for a loan to permit him to buy corn seed, beans, herbicide, fertilizer, tools, etc. Ramón has good payment references and good moral character. He is grateful for the help and is sure he can repay his loan while offering his family the full life they are worthy of.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, beans, herbicides, fertilizer, and tools.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of four hard-working, young women. Irene is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past seven, Irene has been working hard to manage her produce business. She sells maize, rice and coffee.

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase the size of the business and to add different varieties of produce, such as beans, to the things she offers for sale. The inventory bought with the loan will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay tuition for her siblings. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to start a retail shop. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add new varieties of produce, such as beans, to her inventory, and to grow the business

loans.name: Bulala Group

texts.en:
Phelesia is a member of Bulala Group, in Kakamega South District. She is pictured with her group -- 17 One Acre Fund farmers, 15 women and 2 men. Phelesia is standing on the right, with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Phelesia joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Phelesia joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family.

Phelesia reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about two bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested six bags per 1/2 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to help in paying household bills. For the 2013 Long Rains season, the Bulala Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Delina

texts.en:
Delina has approached Kiva's field partner Yehu for a subsequent loan amounting to KES 50,000 to hire manpower in order to make more bricks for resale.

Delina is grateful for previous loan which was very helpful to her. It helped to increase her monthly income hence improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to hire manpower and make more bricks for resale.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 49 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest-producing of rubber plantation in Liberia. Annie is married with seven children between 13 and 25 years old, two of whom still live at home and are in school. Annie was unable to attend school. 

For ten years she has been selling food like rice, onion, oil, pepper, and salt in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money from her mother, and learned this trade from her as well. Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, onion, oil, pepper, and salt for her business. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: o purchase more rice, onion, oil, pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajo en el rubro que le han regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas y al mismo tiempo alcanzar muy buenas ganancias, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, lo buenos precios y el excelente servicio; José María es un hombre amable, honesto muy dedicado a su labor todos los días lucha por ganarse un futuro mejor sabe que con todo su esfuerzo y dedicación lograra el éxito que desea; en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, abono, etc. José María tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José María lives together with his life partner and their children in their own home. He works in agriculture – specifically, growing corn and beans. He has worked for many years in this area, gaining valuable experience which has allowed him to obtain the best harvests and very good profits.  The land he farms is located in a highly agricultural area near his home. He sells his products throughout the surrounding area and has gained many customers who prefer him for the quality of his products, good prices and excellent service.

José María is kind, honest and very dedicated to his work. Every day he strives for a better future knowing that through his effort and dedication he will achieve the success he desires. 

In the most recent sowing season José María suffered some crop losses from which he hopes to recover. For this reason he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide and fertilizer. He says he has excellent repayment references and he promises to repay the loan. At the same time, he is confident that in this way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as a determined and hardworking man. He operates a dairy farm producing milk, and farms tea, maize, cabbage, carrots, and kale, which he also sells. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. 

Joseph's business is located in a productive business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy cow feed, fertilizer and seeds. His business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cow feed, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in Kakata Town. She is 29 years old. She ended her education at 6th grade, married, and now has three children between the ages of 2 months and 12 years old. Two of her children are in school, and all of them live at home. Annie's husband is a builder.

For the past three years Annie has been selling rice, palm oil, sugar, flour, and other food items, in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. She started her business with money that was given to her by husband. She happy with her business,  because of the profit she makes each day. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, sugar, flour, and other food items, to resell at the market

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is married and lives with her children who attend school. Her business is buying and selling goats for meat. She previously worked as a farmer which earns her family income. 

Kwekwe describes herself as a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who always tries hard to improve every day.

She requested this loan to buy goats for resale to make good profits and help her to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale

loans.name: Thikay Maya

texts.en:
Thikay Maya is 42 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 18 and 14.  In 2006, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid eight loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Thikay Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is from Tiribe. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables at the town market. She occupies two stands. She has a fixed customer base, good income, and good business and personal references. She is a hardworking woman and an excellent client.

Margaret is asking for this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock her store with products. This will enable her to continue giving her customers the quality they expect from her.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation area in Liberia. She is married with nine children between the ages of 18 and 30 years old, and only three of them are attending school and live at home.

Fatu did not attend grade school but she was able to attend a vocational school where she learned how to manufacture local soap. For the past ten years she has been making and selling local soap in her community and market.  She spends five hours making the soap, and she spends six hours to distribute the soap to her customers in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, She is requesting a loan to purchase more caustic soda, oil, and wood for her soap-producing business. In the near future, she would like to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more caustic soda, oil, and wood for her business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a very hardworking and committed gentleman. He is married and has been blessed with one child. He runs an electrical shop and has been in business for three years. He requires a loan of 20,857 KES to buy sockets, switches and electric cables.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money for future purposes. He hopes to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy sockets, switches and electric cables

loans.name: Shitechia Group

texts.en:
Shitechia Group is located in Kakamega South District. It is a group of nine women and two men led by Monicah, who is pictured in the middle in a dotted white and black dress. She is receiving an input loan for one half acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Monicah is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and to grow enough food for the family.

Monicah hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to buy a cow. Monica’s group members will each receive input loans of one half acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for five and a half acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en:
Winrose is a 38-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be a social and talkative woman. She operates a retail business and restaurant, where she sells baskets and food. She has been involved in this basket-selling business for more than one year. Her business is located at an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the loan to buy supplies to weave more baskets to sell. Her business goal is to run a curio shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy supplies to weave more baskets to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is applying for this loan, after having successfully repaid the previous loan. She is grateful that the loan helped her to expand her business and gain a wider ranger of customers, resulting in an increase in her monthly income. She is approaching Yehu for a new loan, in the amount of KES 30,000, to build her shop and to stock it with bundles of wheat flour and 30 litres of cooking oil.

loans.use: to build her shop and stock it with bundles of wheat flour and 30 litres of cooking oil.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar vive con su esposa y con sus hijos , con esfuerzo. Es un hombre muy responsable con lo que le corresponde hacer y siempre con la visión de que es cabeza de hogar y el responsable de llevar el sustento diario. Es muy conocido por ser honesto, sincero y responsable siempre ha trabajado por dar lo mejor de siempre ha trabajado por dar lo mejor de si .Alquila su propia parcela de tierra para tener sus propios cultivos y de estos vende cierta parte y es así como se gana la vida aparte que cuando no hay suficiente cosechas trabaja como jornal para subsistir más el día a día.  Julio ha decidido solicitar a INTEGRAL un préstamo para comprar insumos básicos como: Semillas, Abonos, Fertilizantes. Espera contar con la ayuda solicitada pues asi Julio podra seguirle brindando una mejor condicion a su familia.
texts.en: Julio Cesar lives with his wife and their children. He is a very responsible man in what he does, and he always works with the view that he is the head of the household and the one responsible for bringing the daily sustenance. He is very well known for being honest, sincere, and responsible. He has always worked hard to give the best of himself. He rents his own parcel of land in order to have his own crops, and of these he sells a certain part, and this is how he earns a living, except for when the harvest is not sufficient. Then he works as a day laborer in order to subsist day to day. Julio has decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy basic supplies such as seeds, compost, and fertilizers. He hopes to have the help he has applied for, since in this way Julio will be able to continue offering better conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as seeds, compost, and fertilizers

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en: Nyambula is approaching with a loan request amounting to ksh. 40,000 in order to pay school fees for her children. This is after a successful repayment of the previous loan.  She is grateful as it helped to expand her business territory.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is taking out another Kiva loan. She provides food and snack services for small events in addition to preparing sandwiches, sweet snacks, and pastry-making in general.

She requests a loan to purchase eggs, flour, milk, and other things.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, flour, milk, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar, milk and fresh foods.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén de 55 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia.  Rubén  se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como: maíz, frijoles siendo esta  su principal fuente de ingresos, Ha realizado esta actividad por mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida honradamente. Él es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y dedicado en su trabajo. Es muy conocido por sus vecinos los cuales dan buenas referencias de su trabajo como de su persona. Cada año repite está actividad ya que es una persona muy humilde y de escasos recursos el cual no puede tener   otro tipo de negocio o trabajo. Este año al igual que los anteriores ha decidido cultivar la tierra y ya que la temporada de siembra está cerca él quiere estar preparado con los  insumos agrícolas necesarios  para cosechar los principales granos básicos. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a esta institución, INTEGRAL, ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios  para realizar la inversión. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas,  etc. De esta forma espera lograr cultivar los principales granos básicos de este año para poder llevar el pan de cada día a su familia.
texts.en: Rubén is 55 years old and lives in a house on his properly, along with his family. Rubén grows basic foods such as corn and beans, and this is his principal source of income. He has done this work for a long time, and this is how he earns an honorable living. He is a very responsible man, honest and dedicated to his work. He is well known by his neighbors, who give good references for his work as well as for him as a person. Every year he repeats this [farming] activity, since he is a very humble person of scarce resources, so he has no other type of business or work. This year, as in past years, he has decided to cultivate the land, and since the planting season is near, he wants to be prepared with the agricultural supplies necessary to harvest the principal basic foods. This is why he is applying for this loan at this institution, INTEGRAL, since he does not have the economic resources necessary to make the investment. He will invest the loan in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as seeds, compost, insecticides, etc. In this way he hopes to manage to grow the basic foods for this year in order to be able to supply the daily food for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, compost, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 35 years old, married, and has four children, who are aged 8, 6, 4, and 2 years. As a way of taking care of the family, Deo ventured into farming on a small scale to generate income. With what he has earned from the farming business, Deo has been able to educate his children and to begin construction of a residential house, though it is not yet complete.

He wants a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings to complete his house, so he can see the family in a decent environment.

Deo is always challenged by the changing weather conditions that affect agricultural production, plus the fluctuations of prices for agricultural products on the market. His dreams are to start up another income-generating activity, and to engage in the farming business on a larger scale. Deo would like the lender to continue with the partnership, to enable his dreams to come true.

loans.use: To buy building materials for completion of his family's house.

loans.name: Maitta

texts.en:
Maitta is 28 years-old and lives in Kakata the capital city of Margibi County which is the highest producer of rubber plantation in Liberia.  She is unmarried with a nine-year old child who live at home and is at school.

For the last eight years, she has been selling salt, vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onions at the local market.  She started this business with capital given to her by her boyfriend and learned this trade from her friends.  She spends nine hours a day on her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap and onions for her business. She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, rice, pepper, oil, soap, and onion for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is  asking for a second loan.  Her first has had a great positive impact on her business, She was able to obtain a good percentage of the market as customers trust for her keeps growing. She has asked for a loan amounting to ksh. 30,000 in order to restock her retail shop with cereals, sacks of beans, rice and a bundle of maize flour.

loans.use: to restock her retail shop with cereals, sacks of beans, rice and a bundle of maize flour.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is single and has been a member of  Kiva partner Yehu Microfinance since 2011. She buys and sells coal.

She started her business with a wooden wheelbarrow, which she still owns. But over time she bought other work tools, eventually acquiring an open motorcar for her sales activity and product delivery to customers. The problem was that rainy days posed inconveniences. 

She is requesting a loan in order to buy charcoal to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy charcoal in order to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Dommitilah

texts.en:
Dommitilah, a 25-year-old single woman who describes herself as optimistic, has been operating a beauty salon for 12 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of beauty products.

Dommitilah will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products. Her business goal is to diversity her business within five years. This will be her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 45 years old.  She is married and has four children, aged 26, 24, 22, and 18 years.  In 2002, she established her grocery store.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, seven previous loans from Patan BPW.  She used the most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.

In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to resell in her store

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, who lives in Likoni, is married and has children who are still little and are her reason to live. Mwanaisha owns a small but well-stocked firewood store that’s the only one in the neighborhood. She tells us that all of her neighbors come by all the time to buy from her, and thanks to this she does very well and has the necessary resources to support her family day to day. Her goal is to stay in business to be able to give her children a good education so that they won’t have to suffer privations like she had to.

Mwanaisha is requesting this loan because she wants to stock her store with 30 bags of charcoal to continue serving her customers.

loans.use: to stock the store with 30 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora, age 39, operates an animal husbandry business, like most rural people in northern Albania. She has been engaged in her business for almost 20 years. 

She and her husband Dod (shown with her in the picture) have three children between the ages of eight and 16 years old. Dod helps Flora in the business because, as she says, "This makes it easier for me. While I take care of the animals and do the milking and feeding, he takes the milk to the local market."

Since dairy is considered one of the most staple foods in their region, they report that their earnings from this activity are not bad.

Flora now wants to expand their existing stable, since she is planning on adding some more cows and goats to the herd. She has requested a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: to expand her stable, since she will be adding more animals to the herd soon

loans.name: Caroline Wirba

texts.fr: caroline est une femme de 46 ans, marié et mère de 4 enfants.dans un quartier de la ville de Douala, elle possède et gère un mini stand de vente des vivres secs depuis 4 ans. ce crédit va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de marchandises en acheter les vivres telles que le riz, haricot, maïs, huile de palme afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. les profits générés vont augmenter son capital et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. elle ambitionne être reconnu dans son lieu de vente comme la numéro 1 dans ce secteur
texts.en:
Caroline is a 46-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She owns and runs a small stall in Douala, where she has been selling dry foods for four years.

With her loan, Caroline will buy rice, beans, maize and palm oil, which will help her to boost her stock of merchandise and meet the needs of her customers.

Thanks to her profits, she will increase her capital and take care of her family's needs.  Her goal is to become the number one seller of dry foods in her retail district.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, beans, maize and palm oil.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Alice is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past two years, Alice has been working hard to manage her office services business, where she sells printing and photocopying services. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a typewriter, and this purchase will help Alice to generate greater profits and expand the business. Alice hopes that in the future, she will be able to increase her working capital. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a typewriter, enabling her to add a new service to the ones she offers now.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna has been engaged in a poultry farming business for the past 10 years. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and poultry diseases. She earns an additional income from operating a retail shop. 

She and her husband have five children, three of whom are enrolled in school. The family resides in a rented house and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for the family.

Berna has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO, which she will use to buy chicks and bags of chicken feed. Her goal is eventually to own a hatchery and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy chicks and bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Wayua

texts.en:
Wayua operates her retail shop business. Her work is very demanding. She says that her work is very tiring but also gratifying. She also says that there is a lot of competition in her business and often disloyalty. Wayua is growing her business and also sells ladies' clothing and underwear so that she can further meet the needs of her customers.

Wayua is requesting this loan to buy blouses, pants, and shirts so that she can expand in this new field.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, and shirts so that she can expand in this new field.

loans.name: Balkumari

texts.en:
Balkumari is 27 years old.  She is married and has one child, age 3.  In 2004, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, two loans from Patan BPW. She used this third loan to buy grocery goods to resell in her store.

In the future, Balkumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour, are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to resell in her store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has one child. She lives in her own home, in a very calm neighborhood. Fatuma makes "chapatis," or flat bread. She and her husband both work in the business, because it is doing very well. They have a good customer base and have reasonable prices.

She has requested a loan to buy ingredients in bulk for making chapatis, like cooking oil for frying, starch, milk, and corn flour.

loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk for making chapatis (a local kind of flat bread).

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is involved in agriculture. She cultivates potato and wheat and sells the gathered products in the local markets. She is very hard-working and does her best to gather a good harvest and cover her family's basic costs. Mariam lives with her husband and a son, who help her with land cultivation. 

As agriculture is the main source of income for this family, they would like to expand it.

Mariam has applied for this loan to purchase potato, wheat, and barley seeds. This will increase her harvest, and she will be able to sell more products in the market. 

Mariam dreams of having a big farm, and she hopes that this loan is a small step toward her dream.

loans.use: to pay for potato, barley, and wheat seeds

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three school-going children. She runs a clothing shop which has been operating for three years.  

Emmaculate was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to purchase new clothes for sale, such as curtains, dresses, trousers, shirts, etc. Emmaculate believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children. She is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of bad debts.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for sale, such as curtains, dresses, trousers, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es: Rosa de 41 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz, frijol .Esta actividad la realiza  junto a su esposo y es así como logran llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora  y responsable.  Siempre se ha  dedicado a la agricultura por lo que  conoce muy bien la manera de hacer esta activada. Cada año realiza esta actividad de la cual vende una parte de su cosecha y la otra la deja para consumo. Es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y dando a su familia el alimento básico. Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, esto la hace agarrar más fuerzas para seguir luchando por un futuro diferente. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Es así como  se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera que  este año la cosecha sea favorable y logre cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Rosa, 41 years old, lives in her own home with her family unit of her husband and her children.  She makes a living in the agriculture of basic grains like corn and beans.  She performs this activity with her husband and in this way they manage to bring home each day’s bread.  Rosa is an enterprising, hardworking and responsible woman.  She has always worked in agriculture, therefore she knows very well the way to do this activity.  Each year she carries out this activity from which she sells a part of her harvest and the other part is left for consumption.  It is in this way that little by little she is getting ahead and giving her family food staples.  She lives in very humble conditions with her family.  This makes her seize more strength to continue fighting for a different future.  

She has made the decision to request this loan from Integral in order to invest in agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.  It is in this way that she will earn a living and bring home each day’s bread.  She hopes that this year the harvest will be favorable and that she will manage to fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Mesefu

texts.en:
Mesefu is from Likoni and has been selling men’s and women’s clothing and accessories from a rented shop.

She is a client of Yehu Microfinance and has been for more than three years. Thanks to the help she has been receiving, she has been able to improve her business. Her dream is to be able to have her own shop someday, so that she can have a greater income.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy women’s clothing and accessories so she can sell them and continue to work.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothing and accessories so she can sell them and continue to work.

loans.name: Surja Maya

texts.en: Surja Maya is 59 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 35 and 30. In 2000, she established her butcher shop business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy chickens for her shop. In the future, Surja Maya plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 46 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County, which has the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is married with two children aged 19 and 29 years old. Only one lives at home and is in school. For twelve years she has been selling rice, palm oil, charcoal, pepper, etc, in the local market. She started this business given to her by her sister and learned this trade from her friends. She spends nine hours on her business per day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, charcoal, pepper, etc, for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, charcoal, pepper, etc, for her business.

loans.name: Mwarabu

texts.en:
Mwarabu sells women's, men's, and children's clothing and shoes to earn a living. She has been in business for the last four years. Through her enterprise, she is able to contribute toward household expenses in her effort to get ahead.

Mwarabu is requesting a loan in order to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, bermudas, and sport shoes for women, men, and children. This will allow her to have a wider variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, bermudas! and sport shoes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is a married father of four school-aged children. He owns rental houses. He learned of Milango from an employee and joined the organization to obtain credit for business operations.

Hussein is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to purchase a piece of land for farming and complete his new house under construction.

The only challenge in the current business is when some of his customers do not pay their rent on time. Hussein looks forward to overcoming this by diversifying to other forms of business in future, such as farming, to increase his income.

Hussein’s ambition is to construct two more houses.

loans.use: To purchase farm land and complete his new house under construction.

loans.name: Menka

texts.en:
Menka, age 42, established her tailoring business in 2001. She supports her family by working six days a week for eight hours per day. She and her husband have two children, aged 10 and 20 years old.

Menka has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW, and she used her previous loan to buy raw materials for her business. 

In the future, Menka plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  

She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Heghnar

texts.en:
Heghnar is from Marmarashen village and is involved in agriculture. She runs a farm, where she keeps two cows and two bulls, cultivates potatoes and wheat, and grows apple and pear trees. She gets milk and milk products from her cows, which she sells at local open markets. 

Heghnar lives with her husband and their son, both of whom help her to run the farm. The family works hard to gather a good harvest and earn a high income. 

The agricultural business is the sole financial income for Heghnar's family, so she would like to expand it. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase potato seeds as well as to buy forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable her to ensure good nutrition for the livestock and to cultivate more potatoes.

She hopes that this loan will give her an opportunity to expand her agricultural activity and ensure a better life for her son.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds as well as to buy forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha runs a home-based grocery store to earn an income. She has operated her business for about two years. Aside from the usual grocery items, she also sells beverages that generate extra income, especially on the weekend.
 
Mwanasha and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, flour, and noodles at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, and noodles at wholesale

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en:
Safina's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Safina is 19 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Safina has been working hard to manage her small hotel and catering business.

To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital to the business and to buy more chairs. This will help Safina to generate greater profits and expand the business. It will also allow her to afford to cover medical expenses. 

Safina hopes that in the future she will be able to better look after her family. 

Safina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add capital to the business and to buy more chairs

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha lives in Likoni and has a food stall in her home. She says that she has an established clientele. In addition, Mwanaisha states that her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She is an enterprising person who looks to provide better stability for her family each day. Mwanaisha and her husband want to provide the best for their family, so they strive to make this happen. Her goal is to continue growing and expanding her shop. Mwanaisha is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of beverages, vegetables, fruits, milk and other products to keep her food stall stocked.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, vegetables, fruits, milk and other products to keep her food stall stocked.

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es: Abelino vive junto a su familia, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y sorgo, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de siembra esta ubicado en un lugar de alto potencial agrícola, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque todo el producto es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un excelente servicio; Abelino es un hombre entregado a su labor, luchador día a día se esfuerza por salir adelante sabe que solo con esfuerzo y constancia logrará  el éxito que tanto desea, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aprovechar y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, sorgo, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. Abelino tiene buenas referencias de pago es muy responsable, agradece la colaboración y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Abelino lives with his family.  He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of corn and sorghum.  He has several years of work in the field that has given him a lot of experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests.  The land that he plants is located in a place of high agricultural potential.  He sells in all of the surrounding areas of the community.  He already has many customers as people prefer him because all of the products are of top quality and at accessible prices in addition to excellent service.  

Abelino is a man devoted to his work, a fighter who struggles day by day to get ahead.  He knows that only with effort and perseverance will he achieve the success that he so desires.  He would like to make the most of this planting season and carry out a new investment but he is in need of capital.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy corn and sorghum seed, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc.  

Abelino has good payment references and is very responsible.  He is grateful for the collaboration and is sure that he will be able to pay off the debt.  At the same time he is confident that he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum seed, fertilizer, insecticide and tools.

loans.name: Jiparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул 42 года, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Жыпаркул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 15  назад начала заниматься пошивом и продажей национальных ковров и шапок. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день хозяйство Жыпаркул приносит около 20,000 сом в месяц с продажи шапок и ковров. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыпаркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку материалов для изготовления головных уборов и ковров. Доходы от кредита Жыпаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Jiparkul is 42 years old, married, and raising two children.  Fifteen years ago she started sewing and selling traditional carpets and hats, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  

Having started in this business with a capital of 10,000 som (KGS), she now makes about 20,000 (KGS) som per month selling hats and carpets.  

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  

She will use her loan to buy materials to make headdresses and carpets. She plans to invest her earnings into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make traditional hats and carpets.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has operated a grocery store for the past 10 years. She is a recurrent client of Yehu Microfinance. She is a widow and has four children, all of whom attend school. 

Amina has repaid several loans to date and is asking for this one in order to buy such items as beverages, baked goods, sugar, and tea so that she can offer a wider variety of goods to her customers. By providing a greater variety of products, she will attain a larger profit margin, which will help her improve her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, sugar, and tea to offer for sale

loans.name: Susar

texts.ru: Сусар обращается за параллельным кредитом так как с увеличением заказов не успевает выполнять их, так как не хватает машинок и людей. Сусар обратилась в банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 3 швейных машинок. С увеличением производительности, Сусар сможет увеличить свои доходы.Ведь ей предстоит обучать дочку и женить сына.
texts.en: Susar is requesting a concurrent loan, because she is receiving an increasing number of orders, which she cannot fulfill on time due to a lack of machines and workers.  She has therefore turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy three sewing machines.  By increasing her productivity, she will also be able to increase her income.  Susar needs this as she has to finance her daughter's education, and marry her son.

loans.use: to purchase three sewing machines.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam sells clothing to earn an income. She sells her wares from a stand that she bought with much effort. She keeps the stand stocked with a variety of clothes for adults and children. She helps to support her family with her earnings. She and her husband have one child.

She will use her loan funds to buy various clothing items to offer for sale, such as shirts, skirts, and blouses. This will allow her to attract more customer attention and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items to offer for sale, such as shirts, skirts, and blouses

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a charcoal vendor. She is a person with a lot of enthusiasm who is determined to get ahead, which is why she works so hard. She works from very early in the morning, selling charcoal to her neighbours.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy 30 sacks of charcoal. Bags of charcoal are what she most needs and sells every day.

Masika is grateful for this opportunity because it will help her to make progress.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima operates a business selling such food items as meat, vegetables, and bulk foods. Previously, she sold goods door-to-door, but with great effort she was able to establish a shop. Mwanalima has gained many regular customers in the area. She earns her living by tending her shop daily. 

Both she and her husband, who has established his own business, are making great efforts to get ahead and to help their children. Their goal is for their children to finish their studies and become successful people.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy such food items as meat, vegetables, and bulk foods to offer for sale. 

She is grateful for this opportunity and says it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy such items as meat, vegetables, and bulk foods to offer for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a food market where she sells cashew nuts and household food items. The store is well stocked, well-known, and frequented by her neighbors and other occasional customers.

The products that she offers are all basic needs items like sugar, rice, tea, and dairy products.

The requested loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of basic merchandise for the store.

loans.use: to buy such items as sugar, rice, tea, and dairy products to offer for sale

loans.name: Daisy Del Carmen

texts.es: Daysi de 41 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y además con esfuerzo y dedicación tienen una pequeña crianza de gallinas . Esta actividad la realiza  junto a su esposo y es así como logran llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Daysi es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora  y responsable.  Siempre se ha  dedicado a la Crianza de gallinas y venta de huevos. Es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y dando a su familia el alimento básico. Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, esto la hace agarrar más fuerzas para seguir luchando por un futuro diferente. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de unos novillos, y Gallinas . Es así como  se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Daysi is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  She works in agriculture raising basic crops like corn and beans, and in addition, with strength and dedication, she has a small chicken coup.  She works in this sector along with her husband and in that way they provide bread each day for their home.  Daysi is an entrepreneurial woman. She is hard-working and responsible.  She has always worked raising chickens and selling eggs.  In this way she has little by little managed to get ahead and give her family basic sustenance.  She lives in very humble conditions along with her family.  This motivates her to continue struggling for a different future.  She has decided to request this loan from Kiva field partner INTEGRAL in order to invest in the purchase of heifers and chickens.  This is how she earns a living and provides food for her family.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of heifers and chickens

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is married and from Likoni. She is blessed with seven children. Mwanahamisi is very hardworking and has her own food stall in downtown Mombasa. Her business started out with little capital that, added with the good customer service she provides, has led to its growth.

She requests a loan to buy supplies for her store at wholesale to meet customer demands, which will increase sales and as a result, increase her income. She wants to buy items such as cashew nuts, baked goods, condiments, spices, soft drinks, meat products, etc. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because it will be of much help for her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts, baked goods, condiments, spices, soft drinks,  and meat products for her food stall

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a widow and has one child. Mwanalima has had a boutique for more than three years in a strategically located spot in Likoni, Mombasa. She sells assorted articles of clothing like Kikois, shirts, t-shirts, pants, sandals, and belts for cash and on credit. Thanks to her sacrifice she’s getting ahead.

She’s asking for the loan to increase her stock of clothing because sales always increase during these months and she wants to be prepared in the best way possible to provide her customers with quality and a variety of clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell at her boutique

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is married and has 1 child. She is known for being a hardworking person with many entrepreneurial ideas. She has a grocery store that helps her generate income to support her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy more basic products to stock her store in order to satisfy the demands of the community. With this she will also increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more basic products to stock her store

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 

She has a business of selling green bananas. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell. She has been selling green bananas for ten years to all categories of people through retail seven days a week. She generates additional income from renting rooms. Her major business challenges include problems with transporting bunches of green bananas and the rainy season, which makes rural roads impassable. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease in transportation, to educate her children up to the university level, and also to become a wholesaler.    

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a merchant who makes a living buying and selling fish. She has been dedicated to this activity for years, so she already has some good experience. She is known as a person with a strong desire to move up in life and help her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase fish, which she will use to have more fish in stock since demand is high and she wants to be able to satisfy her customers. Linet is grateful for the help she is receiving from Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, because it will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is married with four children who attend school. She makes a living as a merchant. She has a business selling clothes in Likoni, Mombasa. She says she started the business more than ten years ago and that she previously worked in sewing. She used the little capital she made to start her business. Currently, Asha has a variety of merchandise she works with day-to-day to make headway for all of her family members. She has decided to turn to Kiva's partner, Yehu Microfinance, and requests a loan to purchase more merchandise because demand is high right now for clothing. Asha is thankful for the loan because it allows her to satisfy all her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase pants, sweaters, jumpsuits, and jeans to sell

loans.name: Patronala

texts.en:
Patronala has a clothes stand in Likoni, Mombasa. Thanks to the high quality of products that she offers, she has been able to establish a good customer base and earn a good income. She says that she strives to move forward so that she can generate a little more income and have a retirement that is problem-free.

Patronala is requesting a loan to buy bales of clothes for resale and other types of products so that she can restock her inventory and meet the demands of her customers. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: El Guano 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group, El Guano (in honor to their community name) 2, 3 & 4. This group is comprised of 15 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. 

Margarita is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. This businesswoman runs a fried food stall where she sales fried chicken, beef and pork, along with fried dough and plantains. This is a popular business in the Dominican Republic, especially for breakfast and dinner. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing meat, flour, cooking oil, butter, and other goods.

Margarita said that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them while she has been working to support her long-term partner. She will use the profits to reinvest and to save for any needs in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, cooking oil, butter, and other goods for her fried food stall

loans.name: Activos De Santa Fe 1 Group

texts.en:
Zunilda is the coordinator of her group, Activos de Santa Fe 1 (translated as Santa Fe's Active - Santa Fe is the name of their community). This group is comprised of five micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. Being a single mother, she has been working hard to support her children. 

Zunilda is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. This businesswoman has sold clothing for around ten years, starting the business with her own savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes for women, men, and kids.

Zunilda will uses the profits to reinvest and to save for any needs in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 42-year-old married man and father of six children. He has been working in selling cars' used hardware for 21 years. Husein is a hard worker; he is specialized in German cars' needs. He is well-known in the region for the good quality he provides to his customers. Husein is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy an air compressor and a power generator necessary for his business.
 
This is Husein's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower; he was so happy with the previous experience because it came with a positive impact to his business, which reflected on to his family's social and financial situations.

Husein hopes to keep on expanding his business and replying to his customers' needs as much as he can by increasing his merchandise with everything his customers might request.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor and a power generator necessary for his business

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro Antonio vive junto a su pequeña familia; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo además para complementar los gastos del hogar trabaja de jornal; tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de mucha incidencia agrícola  muy cercano a la zona donde reside, comercia en todos los lugares aledaños y ya tiene mucha clientela pues todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Pedro es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presentan, en la última cosecha tuvo pérdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, fertilizante, insecticida, etc. Pedro Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, esta muy agradecido con la ayuda por eso asegura que pagara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida llena de las comodidades que se merecen.
texts.en: Pedro Antonio lives together with his small family. He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and sorghum. In addition, to cover the household expenses. he also works as a day laborer. He has worked for quite a few years in this profession, and he has gained a lot of experience, allowing him to obtain the best harvests. The land he cultivates is located in a zone where agriculture is common, very close to the area where he lives. He sells in all of the nearby places, and he has a lot of customers, because everything he sells is of top quality and at affordable prices, and the service is also excellent. Pedro is an enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. He is always looking out for new opportunities that arise. In the last harvest he had losses, and he wants to recover from them. For this reason he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will permit him to buy corn and sorghum seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, etc. Pedro Antonio has good credit references and is very responsible. He is very grateful for the help with this, and he promises to pay the debt, while at the same time he will give his family a better quality of life, full of the comforts they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn and sorghum seeds, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: David V.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva field partner based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the primary schools in Waterloo, a town near Sierra Leone’s capital city, Freetown.

These able and dedicated teachers are requesting a loan of 3,500,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial challenges and, at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Alfred is the featured leader to this team. The 30 year old is single with two children. A native of Waterloo town, Alfred has been a professional teacher for six years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 46-year-old married man and father of five children. Three years ago he started selling traditional Lebanese kaak (a special baked dough filled with cheese and thyme); he has a small carriage where he sells his products on the street's sidewalk to make his living and provides his family with their necessary needs.

Khalil is a hard worker and he is planning to expand his business through buying a cotton candy machine with a requested loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua.

Khalil is a Syrian citizen, but he is living and working in a Palestinian Camp in Lebanon. He is working hard to expand his business outside the camp soon.

loans.use: to buy a cotton candy machine to expand his business

loans.name: Silvia Alexandra

texts.es:
La clienta Silvia vive en Libertad, tiene 38 años de edad. Ella empezó su negocio vendiendo ropa y sandalia, siempre lo ha hecho ya que dice que este negocio trae muchas ganancias. La ropa y sandalias sale a venderlas por temporada.

El trabajo lo realiza sola, en todo el día en su negocio vende blusas, pantalones, interiores, sandalias y le va muy bien con la ayuda de Dios.

Está casada y su esposo le ayuda trabajando vendiendo ambulantes, tiene un hijo y este estudia en una escuela fiscal, su hijo son el esfuerzo para que ella y su esposo sigan luchando para que su hijo siga adelante.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalones, sandalias. En el futuro la clienta quiere que su negocio siga creciendo invirtiendo en más mercadería para asi poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder pagar los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in Libertad and is 38 years of age. She started a business of selling clothing and sandals. Silvia has always been in this line of work because it generates plenty of income. The clothing and sandals that she offers is sold according to the season.

Silvia conducts her work alone. Every day she sells blouses, trousers, undergarments, and sandals in her business. She has done very well with the help of God. Silvia is married and her husband helps with the traveling sales. She has a son who studies at a state school. Her son is the reason why she and her husband strive to move forward.

With this loan, Silvia will buy blouses, trousers, and sandals. In the future, she wants to keep her business growing by investing in more merchandise. This will enable her to generate more income so that she can pay for her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, and sandals.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan, age 40, has been selling power generators to earn an income for the past 15 years. His business is highly requested in his region, which is why he has to keep his machines up to date. He does this by keeping generator spare parts on hand so that he can respond to any unexpected request. 
 
He has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary spare parts for his business.
 
Adnan and his wife have two children. He is working hard to expand his business as much as he can. His goal is to develop it so that he can cater properly for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy necessary spare parts for his business

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es: Adalberto de 40 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa  y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años cultiva granos básicos como maíz, y frijol. Dicha actividad la repite año con año ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Su sueño es mejorar  su calidad de vida  y la de su familia siempre ha deseado darles algo diferente.  Esto lo motiva a trabajar con más entusiasmo ya que solo con el trabajo logrará dar a su familia lo que tanto desea. Es por estas razones que ha tomado la decisión de acercarse  a esta institución, INTEGRAL,  para solicitar este crédito que le permita invertir en los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, u otros. Espera lograr su objetivo de dar a su familia lo que se merece y poder accesar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adalberto is 40-years-old and lives in his own home with his wife and his children. He has worked in agriculture for many years and harvests basic grains such as corn and beans. He repeats this activity every year since this is his main source of income. This is the way that he makes a living and brings the daily necessities to his household. 

His dream is to improve his quality of life and that of his family. He has always wanted to give them something different. This motivates him to work with more enthusiasm since only with work will he be able to give his family what he dreams of most. It is for these reasons that he has taken the decision to approach the institution, Integral, to request a loan that will allow him to invest in agricultural inputs such as: seeds, manure, insecticides, and other things. He hopes to achieve his objective to give his family what they deserve and to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as: seeds, manure, insecticides, and other items

loans.name: El Guano 1 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of her group, El Guano (an honor to their community name) 1. This group is comprised of five micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Dominga makes her home here in a simple structure, with her long-term partner and their five children. 

Dominga is excited to be taking out her fourth loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. This businesswoman runs a grocery sales stall where she sells candies, potato chips, gum and many other snacks. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing different snacks to increase her business inventory.

Dominga said that her most difficult challenge has been raising her children and educating them while she has been working to support her long-term partner. She will use the profits to reinvest and to save for any needs of her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy candies, snacks, gum, etc.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is a 25-year-old single man, who has been working in the construction business for seven years. Mahdi is a hard working man, who is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary tools for his business. These tools will help him a lot in making his work faster and easier.

Mahdi specializes in pasting tiles, and he is an expert in this domain. His good reputation is spreading all over the region because of his special skills and talents.

He hopes to keep on improving his work and expanding his working zone as much as he can and to recruit a group of people to help respond to increased customer requests.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Nancy Marlene

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeño hijo de 7 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para su pequeño; gracias a su esfuerzo Nancy pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de cosmetología, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de sus padres, Nancy trabaja en su pequeño salón de belleza, brindando servicios de corte, pintado de cabello, manicure y pedicura, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Nancy se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Nancy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una silla especial para enjuagues y tinte de cabellos, de esta manera Nancy espera brindar un mejor servicio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una empresaria de éxito y asi poder sacar adelante a su pequeño.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 28-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica, which is in the District of Parcona. She has a seven-year-old son who she loves and is her main reason for living. Nancy is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts to moving her family forward. She must also be both mother and father to her child. Thanks to her efforts, Nancy was able to study for a technical degree in cosmetology. She enjoys watching television in her free time. On a few occasions, Nancy prepares a delicious dish of “ceviche” (marinated seafood) to share with her family.

With great effort and dedication and the support of her parents, Nancy works at her small beauty salon. She provides haircuts, hair styling, manicures, and pedicures. Nancy begins her work every day in the early morning hours and is able to work approximately eight hours a day. She enjoys her work and believes that she is doing well because of the friendly treatment she provides to her customers.

Nancy is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy a special chair for performing rinses and hair coloring jobs. Nancy hopes that this will allow her to provide better service. She will continue working and striving until she accomplishes her greatest dream of becoming a successful businesswoman. As a result, she will be to help her young son get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a special salon chair.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with nine children. 

Nenita is engaged in a snack processing and vending business, particularly “bolanghoy” (cassava cake) in the local dialect, and earns approximately 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cassava, sugar and other ingredients for her bolanghoy processing business. 

Nenita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Nenita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional cassava, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 56 years old and lives in the village of Guintomoyan in the municipality of Jimenez in Misamis Occidental Province. She is married and has three children.
Lourdes is engaged in a hog raising business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional sacks of feed for her hog raising activity.
Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Lourdes hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 70 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Anastacia is engaged in a hog-fattening business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional sacks of feeds for her hog-fattening activity. 

Anastacia has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, Anastacia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Oscar Atilio

texts.es: Oscar de 37años de edad  habita en casa de su propiedad  junto con su grupo familiar su esposa y sus hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos es decir Maíz, Frijol y maicillo. Este ha sido su negocio desde hace muchos años,Aunque posee una pequeña tienda y tambien una sastreria. Esto es lo que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Oscar es un hombre muy trabajador del cual muchas personas dan buenas referencias.  Por medio del cultivo de estos productos es como puede ir subsistiendo él y su familia ya que cada año al sacar la cosecha pone a la venta una parte para sacar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir otras necesidades del hogar. Su deseo es  invertir  un poco más en la agricultura con el fin de cosechar una mayor cantidad de granos básicos que le permitan mejorar su nivel de  ventas como sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la  que tomo la decisión de acercarse  a INTEGRAL,  para invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas como: abonos, semillas,  fertilizantes, pesticidas etc.  Para invertir en la cosechar de una  mayor cantidad  de granos básicos y lograr el objetivo final de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que logrará resultados favorables
texts.en:
Oscar, age 37, lives at home on his own property with his wife and children. For many years, he's been in the business of growing staple crops, specifically, corn, beans, and sorghum, though he also owns a small store and a tailor shop. This allows him to put food on the table every day in his home. Through raising his crops he is able to go on sustaining his family year after year. Oscar is a very hardworking man of whom many people speak highly, selling part of his crop each season to bring in the income he needs to cover various household expenses.  

His hope is to invest a little more in his agricultural work to achieve a larger crop of staples that will allow him to improve his sales and his income. That's why he decided to get involved with INTEGRAL; to buy some agriculture materials, such as manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc, and invest in a better crop and realize his goal of improving his and his family's living conditions. He puts his trust in God and in his hard work to achieve success.

loans.use: buy invest in agriculture materials, such as manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc,

loans.name: Activos De Santa Fe 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
