Jolina is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic after having successfully repaid her previous loan and has grown her business. Starting with her own savings, this businesswoman has been selling clothing for around five years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes for women, men and kids as well as shoes, cosmetics and other products. 

Jolina is the coordinator of her group, Activos de Santa Fe (Santa Fe's Active--Santa Fe is the name of their community) 2, 3 & 4. This group is comprised of 15 micro-entrepreuners (women and men) located in the City of San Pedro de Macoris. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. Jolina has been working hard to support her children and her long-term partner. Jolina will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to help with her household expenses. 

She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothes, and women's accessories.

loans.name: Amedelia

texts.en:
Amedelia is 48 years old and lives in the village of Leonardo in the municipality of Josefina in Zamboanga del Sur Province. She is married and has four children.
Amedelia has a pig raising business and earns approximately 30,000 PHP every three months doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more pig feed for her business.
Amedelia has been a member of PMPC for almost 5 years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more pig feed for her business.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio is 59 years old and lives in the village of Nacional in the municipality of Jimenez in Misamis Occidental Province. He is single and has three children.
Elpedio is engaged in hog fattening activity and earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase sacks of feed for his hog fattening activity.
Elpedio has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Elpedio hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed.

loans.name: Elida Maribel

texts.es: Elida de 30 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz, frijol. Esta actividad la realiza desde hac es así como loe un tiempo y es lo unico que sabe hacer, de esta manera logra llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Elida es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora  y responsable.  Siempre se ha  dedicado a la agricultura por lo que  conoce muy bien la manera de hacer esta activada. Cada año realiza esta actividad de la cual vende una parte de su cosecha y la otra la deja para consumo. Es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y dando a su familia el alimento básico.  Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Es así como  se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera que  este año la cosecha sea favorable y logre cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Elida, age 30, lives in her own home with her husband and children. Her occupation is growing staple crops, like corn and beans, which she's been doing for a long time and allows her to keep her family fed. An enterprising, hardworking, and responsible woman, she has always worked in agriculture and so she knows the business very well. Every year, she keeps up this business by selling a part of her harvest and keeping the rest for sustenance. This is how she keeps moving ahead, little by little, and providing for her family's basic needs. She decided to approach INTEGRAL about a loan in order to invest in some agricultural materials, like seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. She hopes that this year the harvest will be successful and that she will realize her dreams.

loans.use: buy some agriculture materials, such as manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Josue

texts.es:
El Sr. Josue  tiene 31 años, es soltero vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, y se esfuerza por medio de su trabajo para salir adelante.
 El Sr. Josue se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de ladrillos. Su fábrica está ubicada al costado de su casa, cuenta con clientela bien formada atendiendo que hace mucho que se dedica a esta actividad y siempre da muy buen servicio a sus clientes.
Solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para la compra de arcilla, que es la materia prima principal para su producción, y de esa forma asegurar el cumplimiento de la demanda y la satisfacción de su clientela, y así tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Josue is 31-years-old and is single. He lives in the city of Caacupé and he works hard to get ahead. Josue works in the fabrication and sale of bricks. His factory is located to the side of his house. He counts on his dedicated clients since he has been doing this activity for a long time.  He always provides very good service to his clients. 

He is requesting from Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguayan Foundation) and Kiva a a loan to purchase of clay that is the principle material in his production. In this way he will be able to ensure that he meets demand at the satisfaction of his clients. This way he will have more income to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase clay to make bricks.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama started her firewood business some years ago. She notes that at first it was very difficult; however, with the support of neighbors and relatives, they were able to move forward. Now they have an established clientele and their home-made products are well-liked by all. Salama’s biggest dream is to establish a restaurant business by offering ready-made food to her neighbors and those who go to work.

She is requesting a loan to buy meat, eggs, turnover dough, cooking oil, soft drinks and other supplies that will be used in her restaurant. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, turnover dough, cooking oil, soft drinks and other supplies.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a business buying and selling clothing. She opened her store a year ago, since she previously worked selling vegetables. She is married and has two school-age children.

With a little of her savings, Jane opened her business and became independent. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise, like men's and women's clothing, since she has a good number of customers who come to her store daily.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her clothing store.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 44-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been working renewing and making furniture for three years. His business is going on just fine, but needs an external push to develop more. Today, Mohamad is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to register his pick up to better serve his customers.

This is Mohamad's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing pay back history. His previous loan helped him a lot in increasing his business capital with the necessary used furniture. He is working hard to develop his business more to open a big showroom in the future. He hopes to keep on developing his business more and more to provide his family with a special living standard that fulfills their needs and satisfies their desires.

loans.use: to register his pick up.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin. She is married. Maria is running a kiosk in front of her house. She lives in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students. She will use this loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as fish canes, oil, sugar, biscuits and rice. Maria is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, rice, bread, Coca Cola, Sprite, Fanta, oil and biscuits

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 61 years old and lives in the village of Punta in the municipality of Panaon in Misamis Occidental Province. She is married and has three children.
Evelyn is engaged in a Public Utility Vehicle (PUV) operating business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase spare parts for her PUV’s maintenance and repair.
Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 9 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for her Public Utility Vehicle business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 58 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Conchita operates a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase a new motorcycle for hire.

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for almost nine years. In the future, Conchita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en su primer  ciclo, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Lucia es una de las integrantes,  es una señora luchadora quien con su esfuerzo y gracias a la venta de comestibles que hace está ayudando a su familia. Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y tener los medios necesarios para 
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ingrediente para la venta de ingredientes, como ser carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás y de esa forma poder incrementar sus actividades a parte de su trabajo seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group named “Kuña Guapa” (Pretty Kuña) is in their first cycle. They are hardworking women that make effort to get ahead and through their work are able to help their families. 

Lucia is one of the members. She is a hardworking woman who thanks to her effort and the sale of the food that she prepares, she is able to help her family. Her dream is to continue working to be able to continue helping her family. She has the necessity to request this loan to purchase ingredients for the sale of her food. The ingredients include meats, vegetables, condiments and other items. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and grow her business. This way she will be able to give her family what they need and have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to purchase meats, vegetables, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married and has three children. She is 54 years old and lives in the village of Pines in Oroquieta City in Misamis Occidental Province.
Flordeliza is a fruits vendor, and she sells different types of fruits to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables for her business.
Flordeliza has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Luchi

texts.en: Luchi is 43 years old, married and has six children. Three of her children are in school. She is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Luchi requested a 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Luchi would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chairel

texts.en:
Chairel is 31 years old. She has a common-law husband and two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.
Chairel has a food production business in the Philippines. Chairel requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.
Chairel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Chairel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Yamil Anuar

texts.es: Yamil es un joven graduado de la carrera de ing. en sistemas, trabaja como auxiliar de logística es padre soltero de un hijo a quien apoya con sus ingresos los cuales son muy bajos pero con mucho empeño y dedicación tiene la certeza que obtendrá un mejor empleo y para desempeñarse mejor en su labor y obtener más conocimientos para el desarrollo de su profesión solicita crédito para comprar una computadora y con la facilidad de plazos a pagar le será más rentable este préstamo.
texts.en: Yamil is a young grad student in systems engineering and he works on the side as a logistics associate. He is a single father of one son, who he supports with his income, which is quite low. Nonetheless, with plenty of resolve and dedication he is certain that he'll get a better job. To perform his work better and develop greater professional skills, he's taking out a loan to buy a computer on a payment plan that will allow him to make the most of this loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his education.

loans.name: Victor Sebastian

texts.es:
El Sr. Victor es una persona muy trabajadora, es un cliente recurrente de Kiva y gracias al crédito anterior el pudo comprar repuestos para su vehículo, el cual es su medio de trabajo, ya que se dedica a la entrega de periódicos.
Solicita esta vez el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cubiertas nuevas para su vehículo, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Victor is a hard working person. He is a reoccurring client of Kiva and thanks to the previous loan he was able to buy replacement parts for his vehicle, which is his means of work. He works in the delivery of newspapers. 

He is requesting another loan to invest in the purchase of new covers for his vehicle with which he will be able to continue working and completing the demand of his clients. He is grateful for the new opportunity that he is receiving because it will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase covers for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais apenas 1 frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (capulanas, baldes, pratos, alguidares, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é arranjar uma fonte de rendimento para acrescentar a sua receita e a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en: A single mother of four children, only one of whom attends school, Ana lives in her own home and is the sole breadwinner. She's a business woman and owns her own store where she sells various products. With this loan, she intends to buy materials - decorative fabrics, buckets, dishes, pots, and others - to increase her stock of merchandise. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and build a permanent location, which is why she is committed to diligently paying back her loan so she can take out future loans with Hluvuku. Her challenge is to solidify a stable profit stream that will increase her earnings in the face of a lack of available funding to realize all her plans.

loans.use: to buy materials - decorative fabrics, buckets, dishes, pots, and others - to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Leonila's Group

texts.en:
Leonila is 55 years old and lives in the village of Nacional in the municipality of Jimenez in Misamis Occidental Province. She is married and has three children.
Leonila has a car radiator repair business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional equipment, materials, and accessories for her existing car radiator repair business.
Leonila has been a member of PMPC for almost 7 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Leonila is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has his or her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment, materials, and accessories.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 17 del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, donde se vio que 3 de ellas están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olga, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas y por medio de este trabajo está tratando de mejorar sus ingresos para poder crecer y salir adelante. Ella es una persona con gran esperanza de salir adelante y el día de mañana poder mejorar su economía.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, ya que con ello podrá seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo y salir adelante
texts.en:
The group named “Renacer” (Revival) is in their 17th cycle of the program of enterprising women. Three of these women are below the poverty line. 

One of the members, Olga, in the last survey showed a level of poverty in the second tier. She devotes herself to the sale of garments and by means of this work she is trying to improve her income to be able to grow and get ahead. She is a person with great hopes to get ahead and the day of tomorrow to be able to improve her economy. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase garments of all types because with these items she will be able to invest in her work and get head.

loans.use: to purchase garments for resale.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É docente e quadro do Ministério de Educação. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, pedra, areia, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir mais fontes de receita.
texts.en: Married and a father of four children, all of whom attend school, Teófilo lives in his own home, which he provides for on his own. He's a teacher and works with the Ministry of Education. With this loan, he plans to buy construction materials - cinderblocks, stone, gravel, and others - to continue working on his house. In the future, he hopes to finish his house and be able to provide a more comfortable life for his family. That's why he's committed to paying off his loan diligently, so he can take out future loans with Hluvuku. His main challenge is in identifying further sources of income.

loans.use: to buy construction materials - cinderblocks, stone, gravel, and others - to continue working on his house.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an Avon business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy Avon products to sell to customers.
Leonila has been in this business for five years. Leonila earns more income from e-loading (selling prepaid cellular phone credits).
Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy Avon products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks for her store including cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, and biscuits. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 80 USD. Rita is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, and biscuits.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer está en su ciclo quinto, donde todas se han esforzado por ir creciendo y mejorando dentro del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza y tratan de salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Josefa, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa donde todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día y con ello ayuda a su familia y trata de mejorar sus ingresos.
La Sra. Josefa solicita el crédito para poder recargar su negocio con panificados, bebidas, lácteos, frutas, verduras,  etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group "Renacer", reborn,  is in its fifth cycle, where all have been striving to grow and improve by doing the agenda for women. They are doing the survey of poverty elimination, where five are below the poverty line and are trying to get ahead. 

One of the members is Josefa, who in the latest survey showed a level of poverty within the level one, but is aware that the work and effort she is doing must be continuous and permanent to achieve a total success. 

She tells us that has a small store, where every day, she works from the early hours of the day and with the help her family, she tries to improve their income. 

Josefa requests a loan to restock her business with baked goods, beverage, dairy, fruits, vegetables, etc. which will help her to achieve her business plan, which will improve her income.

loans.use: to restock her business with baked goods, beverage, dairy, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and has seven children. She is 48 years old and lives in the village of Mitazan in the municipality of Aloran in Misamis Occidental Province.
To earn a living, Elena has a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and salt.
In the future, Elena hopes to have more savings for their plan of improving their lives.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar, and salt.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza está en su tercer ciclo, donde 3 de las mujeres están por debajo de la línea de la pobreza. Ellas están luchando por mejorar sus vidas y ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos. Ella tiene un pequeño Kiosko donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas y hasta muy tarde. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo para tener mejores ingresos y así ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de comestibles, los cuales le servirá para poder surtir su negocio y seguir teniendo los medios para ayudar a sus familiares.
texts.en: La Esperanza Group, of which three members live below the poverty line, is in its third loan cycle. The women are struggling to improve their lives and help their families by putting themselves to work. One of the members, Mrs. Ramona, who finds herself in level two poverty according to the most recent survey, has a small Kiosk where she works every day from the early morning hours until late. Her dream is to be able to go on growing her business to achieve better revenues and help her family. She is taking out this loan to buy grocery items, which will allow her to stock her business and go on with the means to support her family.

loans.use: to buy in grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Marlinda

texts.en:
Marlinda is 26 years old. She has a common-law husband and two children. Marlinda works very hard to provide for them.
Marlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.
Marlinda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries.
In the future, Marlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 44 years old. She is married and has five children. With three children in school, Caridad works very hard to provide for them.
Caridad runs a charcoal business in the Philippines, and she requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.
Caridad has been in this business for 5 years.
In the future, Caridad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
This is Vicenta. She previously took out a loan of PHP 8,000 to increase her stock of grocery items and products for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and her personal, household, and business expenses. She also sells street food like fish balls and egg balls for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan of PHP 8,000 to buy groceries, toiletries, drinks, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store, the better because more items to sell will result in higher profits. Her profits from business will help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She is looking forward to this financial increase with joy and gratitude in her heart.

Vicenta hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Enhtuvshin

texts.en: Enhtuvshin is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Olziijargal, aged 29, runs a taxi service in town. Her daughter, Erdenetungalag, who is three, goes to the local kindergarten, and her son, Erdenebayar, who is one, stays home. Enhtuvshin started her business of clothing retail in a rental counter of the local market in 2011. When she gave birth to her son, she stopped the business until now. She is now planning to restart her business in a rental counter of the local market and needs an additional investment of MNT 2,500,000 to buy starting inventory for her new clothing sales business. She is a hardworking and welcoming woman.

loans.use: to buy starting inventory for her new clothing sales business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, age 37 and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Joerey, a taxi driver, and she is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to provide income continually for their everyday expenses.
Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. She also has a meat shop. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.
She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to help her to continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.
Nenita hopes that her businesses will grow even more and dreams of having a happy and healthy family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.
*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like shampoo, sugar, soy sauce and other groceries in her general store.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock (e.g., shampoo, sugar, soy sauce and other groceries) to sell in her general store

loans.name: Myrean

texts.en:
Myrean is a 30-year-old married woman from Garcia, Bohol. She has one five-year-old child. She has run a sari-sari, or variety store, business for five years now. She sells oil, canned goods, toiletries, and biscuits. This is the source of her income. She earns PHP 5,000 a month. Her husband is a fisherman.

Myrean is requesting a loan to buy more items like rice, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasonings, and soft drinks. These items will help her earn higher profits.

In the future, Myrean hopes to expand her business and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasonings, and soft drinks

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en: Casiana is a hardworking entrepreneur in the Philippines with a business buying and selling rice. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her business. Casiana has been in this business for two years. Casiana earns more income from farming rice. Casiana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to provide a more secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 48 years old and married, with six children to look after. She has a small bakery shop. She is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy flour, oil, blue band, sugar, and a stove. She opened her bakery shop a year ago with her own working capital of $50.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, blue band, sugar, and a stove.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
This is Elisa. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business. This has been her business for 15 years now. She also has a computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise like clothes and undergarments needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elisa dreams of expanding her business and remaining organized. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like clothes and undergarments needed in her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candy making business in the Philippines.
Edna requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her candy making business.
Edna has been in this business for 30 years now.
In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her candy making business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 48 years old. Two of her children are in school.

Elizabeth has a buying and selling rice business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Paulin

texts.en:
Paulin is 42 years old and has three children. Paulin is married. One of her children is currently going to school.

Paulin is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Paulin requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Paulin has been pig fattening for 22 years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Paulin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Bina

texts.en: Bina is 35 years old.  She is married and has four children aged 15, 11, 3 and 1.  In 2006, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Bina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 44 years old and married with five children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase items like bread, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

Amelita has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Amelita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items like bread, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ñepytyvo está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde la mayoría trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y por sobre todo ellas están luchando por mejorar y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gregoria quien hace crochet, bordados, y con ello tiene el ingreso para tratar de ayudar a su familia. Cuenta que la vida esta difícil, pero que se esfuerza, ya que no quiere que su familia pase privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos y agujas, y con ello poder seguir haciendo los bordados y teniendo los ingresos que necesitan.
texts.en:
The group Ñepytyvo is in its first loan cycle with the women’s committee, where the majority of the members work and help one another get ahead. They are doing a study on the elimination of poverty; six of the members are below the poverty line. Above all, the members are fighting to better their lives and get ahead. 

One of the members is Gregoria, who crochets and does embroidery to earn an income to support her family. She says that life is difficult, but she works hard because she doesn’t want her family to suffer any of the hardships that she had to endure. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in needle and thread, which she can use to continue doing embroidery and earning the income they need.

loans.use: purchase needle and thread

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
This is Rizalyn, 39, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, a worker, and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Rizalyn operates the family's buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them for a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts, shirts and shorts for kids to expand her product inventory.

Rizalyn dreams of having her own stall so she wouldn’t hane to rent anymore and hopes to give her children a good life and a future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like polo shirts, shirts and shorts for kids needed in her business.

loans.name: Cheyserr

texts.en:
Cheyserr is 23 years old and married with one kid who is in school. Cheyserr works very hard to provide for them.

Cheyserr runs a sari--sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Cheyserr has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Cheyserr would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Erdenebold

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebold, 37 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He and his wife are building decorators. Currently, they are working with a construction business entity on a contract of two years. Also, they have livestock in the countryside and add to their assets by purchasing livestock each year.  His daughter goes to elementary school. The house they live in needs some outer and interior repair. So he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase bricks, roofing material, cement and dry boards. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly in wintertime, the family will burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking and trustworthy individual who deeply cares for his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as bricks, roofing materials etc

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
Hera Devi is 53 years-old. She is married and has one child, age 25.  In 2006, she established her poultry business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chicks for her business.  In the future, Hera Devi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once mature, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 46 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory such as canned goods, soap, noodles, spices, etc.

Jane has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (e.g., canned goods, soap, noodles, spices, etc.) to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Chandrawati

texts.en:
Chandrawati is 47 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 30 and 25. In 2010, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Chandrawati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods.

loans.name: Dulam

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulam is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and six children in a house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Oyungerel, age 51, works in dry cleaning. Two daughters work at local grocery stores as saleswomen, and her son works at a construction site. Daughters Zolzaya, age 23, and Odtuya, age 21, are university students, and Alimaa, age 18, is a senior student at a local high school. 

She has been running her organic dairy products business in a rental counter of a local market since 2004. She had started her business in 2002 as a grocery store. She has gained a lot of experience over the years and paid off her children's university tuition from her profit. She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of organic milk to produce organic dairy products and attend the province's organic dairy products fair. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic milk to produce organic dairy products and attend the province's organic dairy products fair.

loans.name: Gino

texts.es: Gino de 24 años , está casado y tiene un hijo de apenas un año de edad,él vive en casa de sus padres a lado de su esposa y sus hermanos. Gino se dedica a la edición de audio y video para conocidos programas televisivos y radiales de la región, además de alquilar su equipo de sonido y algunos otros implementos para fiestas y eventos sociales de la ciudad, parte de su trabajo consiste en realizar comerciales, sesiones fotográficas, narrar algunos documentales, etc. Este trabajo lo realiza en la casa de su mamá, ya que ahi cuenta con una pequeña oficina. Lleva 3 años en éste negocio, siente que le va muy bien ya que su clientela se ha multiplicado.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos además de que se divierte haciendo esto ya que es algo que le fascina desde muy niño, durante el tiempo que lleva realizando esta actividad aprendió muchas cosas y continuamente está capacitándose en nuevas técnicas de sonido y diseño. Su meta principal es poner un estudio de sonido totalmente implementado, por lo pronto va comprando poco a poco algunos instrumentos que son necesarios para su trabajo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles con este monto comprará algunos cables que necesita renovar, realizará la reparación de un parlante y comprará focos de luces a colores que necesita para alquilarlos.
texts.en: Gino is 24 years old.  He is married and has a son who is just one year old.  Gino lives alongside his wife and siblings in his parents' house.  He makes a living editing audio and video tracks for television and radio programs that are well-known in the region.  In addition he rents out his sound and some other equipment for festivals and social events in the city.  Part of his work consists of making adverts, photo shoots, narrating documentaries, and such like.  He does this work at his mother's house as there he has a small office.  He has had this business for three years and feels it is going well as the number of customers has multiplied.  What Gino likes about his work is that he is making a good income and that he has fun doing it - this type of work is something that has fascinated him since he was a boy.  In the time that he has been doing this work, Gino has learned many things and he is continually training himself to use new sound and design technology.  His main goal is to have a fully equipped recording studio.  In the meantime he is buying some of the tools that he needs for his work, little by little.  On this occasion he is applying for a loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles.  With this money he will buy new cables that he needs to update, he will repair a speaker and buy coloured light bulbs that he needs for renting out.

loans.use: to buy cables and repair music equipment.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 61 years old and married with seven children. Conchita works very hard to provide for them.

Conchita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is 32 years old, married and has one child who is in school.  

Lorelyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lorelyn requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase addtional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorelyn has been pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lorelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase addtional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbold is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife, Tsend-Ayush, age 50, helps her husband to run his wooden furniture manufacturing business, and she works as painter. His daughter, Dondmaa, age 23, and son, Enhbaatar, age 22, study at university. 

He has been manufacturing wooden furniture on their plot of land. He built a non-insulated workplace on their land, and now he is planning to insulate it to be able to work four seasons of the year. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase insulation material and inventory for his newly built workplace. He is a hardworking and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and inventory for his newly built workplace.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica de 23 años ,está casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, ella vive al lado de ellos en la casa de sus suegros. Jessica se dedica a la venta de comida. Su trabajo se inicia desde muy temprano ya que todos los días se dirige al mercado a comprar los ingredientes necesarios para preparar los más ricos platillos . Prepara todos los potajes durante el transcurso del día y su horario de atención empieza a las 5 de la tarde y termina muy entrada la noche . Trabaja sola y lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 3 años.Le gusta su trabajo por que puede dedicarle el tiempo y la atención necesaria a sus hijos que son aun pequeños y necesitan de su cuidado, durante el tiempo que tiene trabajando en éste negocio, aprendió a brindarle siempre una sonrisa al cliente y darle una buena atención, pues eso hace que vuelvan a su puesto y de esta forma conserva su clientela. Espera seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho hasta ahora e implementar su negocio con más mesas y sillas hasta conseguir un establecimiento más grande.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 soles para la compra de una mesa y 4 sillas cuyo precio promedio es 100 soles, otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes e insumos como pollos, carnes, papas, aceites y embutidos . Además se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que esta recibiendo ya que eso le servirá para avanzar con su negocio.
texts.en: Jessica is 23 years old.  She is married and has two young children.  She lives alongside them in her in-laws' house.  Jessica makes a living selling food.  She starts very early as every day she goes to the market to buy the necessary ingredients to make the most delicious dishes.  She prepares all the stews throughout the day and starts serving customers at 5pm.  She finishes late at night.  She works alone and has been doing this for three years.  Jessica likes her work because she can spend time with her children and give them the necessary attention.  They are still young and need her to look after them.  In the time that she has been working, Jessica has learned always to give her customers a smile and good service as this is what makes them return to her and so she keeps customers.  She hopes to continue with this work and expand with more chairs and seats, and even look for larger premises.  On this occasion she is applying for 2000 Nuevo Soles for a table and four chairs, which sell for about 100 Nuevo Soles.  The rest of the money will be used to buy ingredients and supplies such as chicken, meat, potatoes, oil and sausage.  She is very content with the financial support that she receives as it will help her to progress to with her business.

loans.use: to buy a table and chairs and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. Merly is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Merly requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Merly has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items (e.g, soft drinks, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, groceries, etc.) for her general store.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita, de 27 años, es una mujer alegre y esta casada con Juan ,con quien tiene tres hijos , es por ellos por quienes trabaja ya que desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Juanita consiste la venta de diversas golosinas por esta razón tiene un puesto de venta instalado en la vereda de su hogar. Considera que tiene un negocio muy rentable ya que tiene una buena fluidez de clientela . Lleva con la misma rutina de trabajo cerca de 10 años y desde que empezó a ejecutarlo lo ha hecho siempre sola. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que siempre le ha fascinado estar en contacto con los clientes, afirma que ha sido muy complicado para ella poder establecer su pequeño negocio ya que anteriormente vendía prendas de vestir pero no le pagaban a tiempo y eso le daba cierto temor de emprender otro negocio, a pesar de ello nunca se rindió y hoy tiene muchos planes con su actual negocio , por el momento solo desea incrementar su capital .En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará galletas, caramelos, chocolates, chicles, chizitos, chupetes y otras golosinas para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en: Twenty-seven year old Juanita is happy and married to Juan.  They have three children together and it is for them that they work as they want to provide them with a better quality of life.  Juanita's work consists of selling various sweets so she has stall on the pavement outside her house.  She thinks her business is very profitable as she has a regular stream of customers.  She has had the same working routing for nearly ten years and she always worked alone.  Juanita likes her work a lot as she enjoys the contact with customers.  She says it has been very complicated for her to establish her small business and before she sold clothes but customers did not pay on time.  This scared her a little when thinking about starting this new business.  In spite of this, Juanita never gave up and she now has many plans for her business.  For now she just wants to increase her capital.  On this occasion she is applying for 500 Nuevo Soles and she is grateful to all those who make this loan possible for her to continue with her objectives.  At the same time she promises to be prompt and responsible on repaying her loans.  With the loan she will buy biscuits, sweets, chocolate, chewing gum, cheese puffs, lollipops and other sweets so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: 12 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres 12 de Diciembre es de la Ciudad de Santaní, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y están trabajando para poder seguir creciendo.  Son mujeres jefas de familia, que desean poder ayudar a sus familias y así darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Este comité es un grupo muy unido y capaz de desarrollar actividades que fortalezcan la economía de su vivienda y del grupo.
La Señora Benjamina, una de las miembros, vende productos de limpieza que ella prepara semanalmente en el centro de la ciudad, así también vende los productos agrícolas producidos por su marido y de esa forma ambos se ayudan por salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de una microfranquicia de limpieza, que tiene los productos que ella necesita para hacer sus productos de limpieza y de esa forma seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women named “12 de Diciembre” (December 12th) is in the city of Santaní. The members are in their second loan cycle and are working so that they can continue to grow. These women are the heads of their families and they want to help them. In order to do this, they are giving their best so their families do not feel deprived. This committee is a unified and capable group that has developed in activities that strengthen their financial standing in their homes and as a group.

Sra. Benjamina is one of the members. She sells cleaning products that she prepares weekly in the central part of the city. Benjamina also sells farm products that are grown by her husband. Both business activities enable her to move forward and help her family get ahead.

Benjamina is requesting a loan in order to buy a cleaning franchise so that she can have the resources that she needs to make cleaning products. As a result, she will be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy a cleaning franchise for making cleaning products.

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Cathérine est une femme de 50 ans mariée mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate, fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un camion des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Cathérine, age 50, is married and the mother of a family. For about fifteen years, she's been a merchant who retails fresh products (tomatoes, fruits) depending on the season in one of her town's markets.

She has a good knowledge of the producers and of her clientele, which she acquired over time thanks to her experience in this field.

Nevertheless, she's constantly out of stock because she's forced to sell everything before being able to buy new products, due to her small working capital.

She would like to buy a truckload of plantains in order to have a large stock, which will enable her to better meet a constant customer demand and avoid getting out of stock.

She will save her profits, not only to expand her business, but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old, and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anita has a general store in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, detergent, sardines and other groceries.

Anita has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Anita would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, detergent, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en: Sangita is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children ages 3 and 1. In 2010, she established her grocery store. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future Sangita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger quantities, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her pasal (small grocery store).

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 28 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to sustain her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 3 piglets and to build a pig stall.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells vegetables in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Raquel has been in this business for 3 years. Raquel earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetable to sell in her market stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and corn in bulk to sell at her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Zay

texts.en: Mr. Zay is 37 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a house in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Narantsetseg, age 41, helps her husband to run their traditional boots manufacturing business at home. His son Anhbayar, age 20,  stays home and helps with his parents' business, Suh-Ochir, age 14, and daughter Dagiisuren, age 7, go to a local school. Zay started his traditional boots manufacturing business in 1992. They sell their boots to retailers of big markets and produce around 35-40 pairs of boots per month. Mr. Zay needs 2,000,000MNT to purchase inventory now before the lunar new year when the prices are at a minimum. The borrower and his wife are hardworking, open-minded and modest people.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his shoe manufacturing business before the lunar new year while prices are at their minimum.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 27 years old. Thelma is married and has 2 children who are in school.
Thelma is raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.
Thelma has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 50 años de edad, esta casada hace 19 años con Antonio y junto a él tiene 3 hijos , Juntos viven en la casa de material novel que ellos construyeron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Isabel es la venta de comidas típicas de la región y asados de carne , para ello se instala en el frontis de su casa, desde donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la tarde. Lleva en este negocio 5 meses y trabaja sola.Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y la necesidades diarias que requiere la crianza de sus hijos, por lo contrario no le gusta cuando el precio de los insumos que utiliza suben repentinamente reduciendo sus ganancias, pero aun así logra encontrar la rentabilidad en sus ventas, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio ampliándolo con mejores sillas y mesas para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1800 soles, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para seguir con su negocio y avanzar con sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará todos los ingredientes  al por mayor  tales como arroz, aceites, papas y otros para así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: 50 year old Isabel has been married to Antonio for 19 years and, together with him, she has 3 children. They live together in a house made of new materials that they built with great effort. Isabel works selling the typical food of the region and roast meats. She does this in the front part of her house, from where she can attend to her customers in a kind and cordial way. She works every day until 6 at night. She has been running this business for 5 months and works alone. She likes her business as it permits her to have an income with which to cover the household expenses and the daily needs for bringing up her children. On the other hand, she doesn't like it when the cost of the supplies that she uses rises all of a sudden, reducing her income. However, even when this happens, she has been able to keep her sales profitable. She has plans to continue with her business, growing it by having more chairs and tables to offer her customers greater comfort. On this occasion, she is requesting $700. She is grateful for the financial support that she is being offered to continue with her business and move her plans forward. With the money she is requesting, she will buy all the ingredients in bulk, for instance rice, oils, potatoes, and other things so that she can get the best profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including rice and potatoes.

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en: Mr. Ochirbat is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a house in Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Narantuya, age 47, runs their family business of traditional boot manufacturing together with her husband. His son, Lhagvadorj, age 21, works for a local private company and Ochirdorj, age 19, is a freshman at an engineering university. The borrower has been running his traditional boot manufacturing business at home since 1997. He has already built close relationships with customers and suppliers. He is now requesting 1,000,000 tugriks to purchase leather inventory before the lunar new year when the price of inventory falls to the minimum. He is a hardworking, responsible and trustful man.

loans.use: to purchase leather inventory to manufacture traditional boots before the lunar new year.

loans.name: Meredith

texts.en: Meredith is 44 years old and has three children. Meredith is married and has one child who is in school. She is in an agricultural business, buying and selling pigs in the Philippines. Meredith requested a 30,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to sell. Meredith has been buying and selling pigs for 15 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Meredith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, es madre de tres hijos de 20, 14 y 10 años respectivamente a quienes educa y cría con la finalidad de hacerlos personas de bien para la sociedad, ella está casada y tiene su casa propia .El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de productos de belleza, entre los productos que vende destacan los que son usados en aseo y cuidado personal, tratamiento facial, colonias, perfumes, algunas joyas, ropa y otros. Todo su trabajo lo realiza en su casa o por las calles de la ciudad ya que los ofrece entre sus amigos y conocidos .Se inició en este trabajo hace 4 años le era complicado poder realizarlo con éxito ya que no sabía muy bien como lograr obtener a sus clientes, pero con el tiempo fue aprendiendo y capacitándose con técnicas de ventas, así pudo salir adelante y logró consolidarse como una vendedora exitosa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para hacer otras actividades que desee, además de brindarle también la atención necesaria a sus hijos, le está yendo muy bien ya que los ingresos que percibe le permiten proyectarse con planes a futuro, pero lo que desea por ahora es seguir creciendo y aumentar la variedad de productos  para que así sus ganancias se multipliquen.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500 soles para comprar un lote de perfumes, joyas, ropa y accesorios que le permitirán tener a su negocio con mayor clientela, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
texts.en: 41 year old María is a friendly and hardworking woman. She is the mother of 3 children, who are 20, 14, and 10 years old respectively. She is bringing them up with the ultimate goal of having them be valuable members of society. She is married and has her own home. María works selling beauty products and, amongst the products that she sells, those that are used for personal cleanliness and care stand out: facial treatments, perfumes, some jewelry, clothes, and other things. She does all her work in her house or in the streets of her city as she sells her goods to her friends and people she knows. She began this work 4 years ago and it was difficult for her to start well as she didn't know very well how to get clients. But, with time, she learned and taught herself sales methods. In this way, she was able to get ahead and offer her children the attention that they need. The business is doing very well and the income allows her to make plans for the future. However, what she wants now is to keep growing the business and increasing the variety of products that she sells so that her profits will increase. At this time, she is requesting $200 to buy a batch of perfumes, jewelry, clothes, and accessories that will enable her to have more customers for her business. She is very happy to know that she has financial support as this makes her feel more secure in building her business. What's more, she promises again to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de Fátima se encuentra en el 1º ciclo y esta integrado por 10 señoras de la ciudad de Santaní. Este comité es un grupo muy unido y capaz de desarrollar actividades que fortalezcan la economía de sus viviendas y del grupo.
La señora Irene se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, el crédito que solicita lo quiere invertir en la compra de animales, como ser gallinas, patos, etc. Irene dice que gracias a su trabajo puede ir mejorando su economía e ir creciendo como microempresaria. Su sueño es poder tener mucha cantidad de animales y así poder tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima committee is in its first loan cycle and is composed of 10 women from the city of Santaní. The group is very united and capable of developing activities that support the members’ household economy.

Irene raises and sells animals. She is requesting a loan to invest in animals, such as chickens, ducks, etc. Irene says that thanks to this work, she can improve her home economy and grow as a small business owner. Her dream is to have a large number of animals and be able to earn a better income.

loans.use: purchase farmyard animals to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 67-years-old and married with four children. He works very hard to provide for them.

Roberto runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Roberto has been in this business for six years and sells shampoo, canned goods and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Roberto would like to build and expand his business to support the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, a 30-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for six years, and also earns an income from fishing.

Teresita, who has received and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF, is now requesting a new one for PHP 15000 to purchase more stocks to sell such as coffee, sugar, bread, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell such as coffee, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is 53 years old, maried and has nine children. 

Demetria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Demetria has been raising pigs for five years now, and she has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Demetria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Demetria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 39 years old, is married and has five grown children. Susan is a woman with full of determination and love of her family. Her husband works as farmer.

She is engaged in selling different products within the community. Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, spices, sugar, cooking oil and drinks for her store. She is dreaming that someday she can build her own stall in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, sugar, cooking oil and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Mwanajuma's Group

texts.en: Mwanajuma is a 57-year-old mother of nine. To earn income for her family, she sells uniforms to local schools but faces the challenge of customer inconsistency. Mwanajuma is also a volunteer community health worker. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, as she says, "I have some land and I feel I want to do what KOMAZA is doing and be a part of KOMAZA in planting trees." With the profits from her tree farm, Mwanajuma plans to build a good house for her family, install electricity and piped water, and build a water storage tank. Her favorite part of the KOMAZA microforestry program is "seeing from my neighbors that the trees are doing well and learning how to plant trees." Also pictured with the group of three is Kuvuna, who is a cosigner for Nyevu's tree farm.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 63 años,está casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su último hijo en la casa que construyeron hace muchos años como producto de su trabajo . Mercedes es dueña de una bodega que está ubicada en su hogar, vende todo tipo de abarrotes y gaseosas de las mejores marcas , tiene muchos clientes ya que es la única bodega de  la zona . Lleva ya en éste negocio 25 años y cuenta con la ayuda eventual de su esposo en la atención mientras que su hijo genera ingresos adicionales con otro trabajo. Recuerda que cuando empezó con esta actividad no tenia muchos conocimientos de cómo llevar a cabo esta función, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora es una experta vendedora .Le agrada su trabajo por que está en contacto con la gente y así no se siente sola cuando su esposo e hijo salen a trabajar, además le genera buenos ingresos debido a las elevadas ventas que tiene a diario.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500 soles para comprar algunos abarrotes de mayor consumo como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceite leche, gaseosas, panes, embutidos y otros productos que ofrece en su tienda a su vez se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero que esta recibiendo ya que eso le servirá para avanzar con su negocio .
texts.en: 63 year old Mercedes is married and lives with her husband and their youngest child in the house that they built many years ago as a result of her work. Mercedes is the proprietor of a grocery store which is located in her home. She sells all sorts of groceries and sodas of the best brands. She has many customers as it is the only grocery store in the area.  She has been running this business for 25 years and has help from her husband and her son brings in income from other work. She remembers that, when she began this business, she didn't have much of an idea of how to do it. But, with time, she learned and know she is an excellent sales person. She likes her work because she gets lots of contact with people and so she doesn't feel lonely when her husband and son leave for work. In addition, she makes good profits because of the high sales that she has every day. At this time, she is requesting $975 to buy some staple groceries such as rice, sugar, eggs, oil, milk, sodas, bread, sausages, and other products that she offers in her store. For her part, she feels happy about the financial support that she is receiving as it enables her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a computer shop in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional computers for this business. 

Julie has been in this business for 1 year. She earns additional income from a general store.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional computers for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Devorah

texts.en:
Ma. Devorah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Devorah requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ma. Devorah has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Ma. Devorah would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, a mother of seven children, is 59 years old and a widow residing in Thmor Koul district of Battambang Province.  

To sustain her living, she grows rice on two hectares of leased farmland. This is a business that she just became involved in one year ago. 

Mao, a seven-time borrower, has formed a group with a fifth-time borrower. Each of them is seeking 176,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy necessary materials to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to own a proper latrine to improve the health of the family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 41 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To generate income, Jean is engaged in the hog-raising business. She has been in this business for almost three years.
