This is Gina. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan in order for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gina hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Belandina

texts.en:
Belandina is a 60 year old married woman. She lives with her husband and their 4 children. Belandina is running a cake selling business within a school’s canteen for the past several months.  She wakes up early in the morning to prepare cakes such as fried banana, fermented soy bean, fried tofu, etc to sell at the school canteen. If all the cakes have sold, Belandina will return home and continue her daily routine.  

Belandina has joined TLM’s lending program for the second time by applying for an IDR 4,500,000 loan for her children’s school fees and to improve her business. She would like to buy more cake ingredients such as: flour, sugar, bananas, frying oil, etc. Belandina is hoping that the business will run well so she can complete the repayment to TLM and to fulfill her family's needs.

loans.use: To cover her children's school fees and to to buy more ingredients to make cakes such as: flour, sugar, bananas, frying oil, etc.

loans.name: Leyerlita

texts.en:
This is Leyerlita. She previously received a loan of 10,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantity and variety of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the more items she will sell which will result in a better profit. Her profit from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leyerlita dreams that her business will grow bigger and also dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 47-year-old lady. She is married to Ezekiel and they are blessed with seven children, the young one being six years old and in school.

She deals in cereals and has been doing this business for the last 13 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 5,000. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD and the previous loan was paid back. She will use the loan to increase the quantity of her stock by purchasing more maize, beans and millet.

She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business. Her dreams and hopes for her business and her family is to run a successful business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans and millet.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old from Olkalou and is married with six children who are all in school.

Peter has a stone mining business that he has been running for the past six years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy modern mining equipment that will enable him work better.
He hopes to own a pickup in the near future.

loans.use: to buy modern mining equipment.

loans.name: 3.13.242.07.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vụ operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

Vụ is 47 years old and is married with 2 children.
Vụ is the group leader of the 3.13.242.07.Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.

Her children are grown up so Vụ supports no dependents with her business in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
In 2011, Vụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vụ has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Vụ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital.
With her business profits, Vụ hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell at her foodstall.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a 34 year old hard working lady who is married with two children, She lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. She is married to Jonny who is a farmer and all their children are in school. Her major monthly expenditure is the school fees payment. She has a water selling business where she sells water to the Kaloleni residents. She has requested a loan amounting to ksh.30000 to buy a water tank due to the expanded need for water.

loans.use: to buy a water tank due to expanded need for water.

loans.name: Marguerite Germaine

texts.fr: Germaine st une dame âgée de 49 ans, célibataire et mère de 03 enfants. Trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. comme activité, elle dispose d'une vente à emporter-resto dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 03 ans environ. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson et des denrées alimentaires  afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et aussi d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Germaine is a 49-year-old woman, unmarried, and the mother of three children, all still going to school. For work, she has had a take-out restaurant in a district in the capital for about three years. She benefits from good experience in this domain. But her capital no longer allows her to satisfy all her customers, who are sometimes compelled to turn to the competition. This is due to her meager capital. 

She would like to use this loan to increase the number of cases of beverages and some food items, so as to satisfy customer demand. Her sales will grow as a result, as well as her profits. The revenues generated will enable her to do better in meeting family needs and also to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase a stock of beverages by the case and of foodstuff for her restaurant

loans.name: Juana Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Juana es propietaria de un local de venta de comida y de tortillas ubicada en el mercado municipal de nuestra ciudad de san Rafael del sur, Managua.
Por muchos años se había dedicado a las labores domesticas privadas, sin embargo por iniciativa propia decide poner su propio negocio para contribuir en su desarrollo personal y familiar, mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
Su negocio tiene mayor demanda, por lo que necesita mayor capital de trabajo para atender con calidad en su punto de venta.
Es una madre trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante y ser un agente de cambio en su comunidad y su familia.
texts.en: Juana owns a food and tortilla stand located in the town market of our city, San Rafael del Sur, Managua. For many years, she worked in private domestic service, but through her own initiative, she decided to start her own business to contribute to her personal development and her family's development, improving her children's lives. Her business has greater demand, so she needs more working capital to run her stand in a quality manner. She is a hard-working mother who wants to move forward and be an agent of change in her community and in her family.

loans.use: to buy pork, oil, rice, and corn.

loans.name: Maria Aleen

texts.en:
Avelina is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has had a retail business for over 5 years and earns 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every month. 

Avelina joined GDMPC in 2012, and  has now requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar and sticky rice. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar and sticky rice.

loans.name: Elius

texts.en:
Elius is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Kaloleni, Kenya. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells mainly clothes and other general merchandise. He started this business four years ago and has been able to expand his business territory in the market.

He has approached with a loan request amounting to 30,000 Kenyan shillings to restock his shop with bundles of clothes. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to restock his shop with bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 29 years old. She is from Nakuru and is married with two children who are aged 1 and 3 years old.

Annah has a grocery business that she has been doing for the past one year. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more onions and tomatoes to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to buy a rickshaw in the near future.

loans.use: to buy onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Abahizi Group

texts.fr:
Alexis fait partie du groupe  Abahizi et  habite à  Ngozi. Il a 43 ans et est marié  à Justine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  âgés de 2 à 5 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (bananes, choux, savon,…) depuis  5 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter   beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (bananes, choux, savon,…), à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait   avoir un grand capital pour augmenter les articles de sa boutique.
texts.en:
Alexis is part of the group Abahizi and lives in Ngozi. He is 43 years old and married to Justine, a farmer. Together they have two children, aged 2 and 5 years old. 

Alexis has been a grocer (bananas, cabbage, soap, …) for five years. 

He is on his second loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many items for his store (bananas, cabbage, soap,…) to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to have a lot of working capital to expand on the items in his store.

loans.use: to purchase many items for her store (bananas, cabbage, soap,…) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Marlin

texts.es: Marlin, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea de Esparta Atlántida con sus esposo y sus hijos. Marlin anteriormente se dedicaba a la cría y engorde de cerdos y venta de refrescos pero opto por establecer un negocio de venta de comidas y pulpería, este negocio tiene 3 años de experiencia, ella vende pollo frito con tajadas, pastelitos rellenos con carne y tacos. También vende churros, refrescos, pan, y otros productos de abarrotería. Ha decidido obtener este préstamo que es por 18,000 Lempiras con el fin de comprar productos comestibles como granos básicos, arroz, manteca, azúcar, pan, huevos, refrescos, churros, condimentos etc.  Para surtir la pulpería y cubrir los pedidos de los clientes. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y tener bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Marlin, age 38, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and their children in a village in Esparta Atlántida.  Marlin previously raised and fattened pigs and sold soft drinks.  However, she opted to establish a business of selling food and groceries.  

She has three years of experience in this business.  She sells fried chicken with plantains, meat turnovers, and tacos.  She also sells churros, soft drinks, bread, and other grocery products.

She has decided to get this loan for 18,000 lempiras in order to buy food products.  She will buy things like basic grains, rice, shortening, sugar, bread, eggs, soft drinks, churros, and condiments, etc.  She will do this in order to stock the kiosk and to cover the customers' orders.

Her goal is to make the business grow in order to get better income and to have a sense of well-being for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita comprar productos de belleza, ya que el negocio que tenía anteriormente fue retirado por la delincuencia que la asechaba, ella se comprara perfumería, cremas, shampoo, entre otros productos, que es a lo que actualmente se dedica a vender.
Ella comenta su experiencia con otros préstamos anteriores, han sido de mucha utilidad, pero que debido a la delincuencia quebró con sus ventas y tuvo que cerrar el negocio, hoy en día se dedica a vender productos de belleza, para volver  a comenzar en el comercio, ella espera que este reinicio sea exitoso para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en: Claudia has decided to take out a new loan, because she needs to buy beauty products. Her previous business was closed because of the crime that threatened it. She will buy perfume, creams, and shampoo, among other products, which is what she currently works selling. She says that her previous loans have been very helpful, but due to crime, she could not sell and had to close the business. Today she is working selling beauty products in order to start over in her business. She hopes that this new beginning will be successful in order to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and shampoo

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Ana tiene una panadería donde produce una gran variedad de pan como pan simple, empanadas, picos, pan tostado, entre otros.
Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad comercial y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, oficio que aprendió de una panadería particular.
El producto lo distribuyen en su camioneta en diferentes comunidades de la ciudad de san Rafael del sur, Managua.
Su demanda ha tenido un significativo crecimiento en estos últimos meses, por lo que necesita mayor capital de trabajo para hacer frente a los pedidos de sus clientes, y necesita del apoyo financiero para producir más pan.
Es una persona trabajadora y honesta, y en su negocio genera cuatro empleos directos, beneficiando de igual forma a cuatro familias.
texts.en: Ana has a bakery where she makes a large variety of breads like simple bread, empanadas, picos (a kind of bread made with sugar and soft cheese) and toast, among other things. She has been doing this activity for years and has her husband's support. She learned this trade in a private bakery. They distribute the product in different areas of San Rafael del Sur, Managua, using a truck. In recent months, her demand has increased significantly, which is why she needs more working capital to meet her customers' orders, and financial support to make more bread. She is a hard-working and honest person. She has four direct employees at her business, likewise benefiting four families.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Lupena

texts.en:
Lupena is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of eight children.

Lupena is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and eventually her harvest.

In the future, Lupena hopes to expand her farming business and save money for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertlizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a truckload of plantains and some bananas

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Pefecta is 66 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Perfecta has a business raising pigs for sale in the local community. She has had her business for over 10 years and earns 8,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 48 years old from Nakuru. He is married with two children who are aged 16 and 15 years old.

Joseph has a business selling shoes that he has been running for the past 8 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET, LTD. to enable him to buy more stock of shoes to sell.

He hopes to own rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Handdorj

texts.en:
Handdorj is 71 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Tserensodnom, age 60, is unemployed and stays at home. 

Handdorj has been running his shoe repair business in a rental place since 2000. He is a hardworking, open minded, and diligent man. He has already built a close relationship with customers in the area. He lives far from his workplace and needs 3,500,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to reduce his transportation expense.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to reduce his transportation expense.

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr: Germaine est une femme de 26 ans célibataire mère d'un enfant de 3 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate, huiles, oignons...)dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter le stock des cajots de tomate, bidons d'huiles pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Germaine is a 26-year-old woman, unmarried, and the mother of three children. She is a merchant, and for fifteen years, she has been selling staple foods retail (tomatoes, oil, onions, …) at a local market. She has good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her customer base, which she acquired over time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself short of inventory, since she is compelled to sell all of it in order to get more. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to have more crates of tomatoes and containers of oil for a good inventory. This will enable her to satisfy further the constant customer demand and to avoid shortages. She will save her profits not only for expanding her business but also for meeting the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes and oil for her customers

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
Françoise est une femme de 41 ans célibataire mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 4 et 25 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, ignames et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 02 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un pick-up des régimes de plantains et bananes pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
.
texts.en:
Françoise is a 41-year-old woman, unmarried, and the mother of four children, from 4 to 25 years old. She is a merchant, and for two years, she has been selling staple foods retail (cassava, plantains, yams, and fruit) according to the season at a local market. She has good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her customer base, which she acquired over time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself short of inventory, since she is compelled to sell all of it in order to get more. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to purchase a pick-up truck of plantains and bananas to have a good inventory, thus allowing her to satisfy the constant customer demand and to avoid shortages. She will save her profits not only for expanding her business but also for meeting the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a truckload of plantains and bananas

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is 35 years old, married, and a mother of three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of 19,180 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

Celestine was introduced to KADET Ltd. by our credit officer, and is applying for her second loan of 39,000 KES, to buy dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves, and water cans for the cows to drink from. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her farming activities.

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves, and water cans for the cows to drink from

loans.name: Mundenye

texts.en:
Mundenye is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. With all her children in school, she finds most of her monthly income is spend on school fees. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store, a business she has been running for six years, in Kaloleni, Kenya, her home town. She has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy stock to sell like soap, soy sauce, soft drinks, cooking oil and spices.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like soap, soy sauce, soft drinks, cooking oil and spices.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This is 47 years old Mahmoud.  He is married and has 3 children aged 19, 20 and 5. He has 2 additional dependents, who lived with him as a sales assistant and to help his wife with the house chores. In 1992, Mahmoud established his brief cases and suit cases business. He began his business because he wants to improve his livelihood. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,520,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. He has repaid 3 loans. Mahmoud requires a loan in order to purchase more suit cases for resale. He hopes that this loan will help in increasing and maximizing the profit through proper utilization. In the future, Mahmoud plans to expand and to move to a shop.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy luggage to sell.

loans.name: Petrus

texts.en:
Petrus, 31, is married to Elisabeth, 29. They are blessed with three children.

To make a living, Petrus sells vegetables such as squash, mustard, spinach, salty fish, etc. He runs the business besides his house. In order to better meet his family's needs, Petrus intends to initiate a kiosk business at his home based to be operated by his wife but he has very limited capital to make it happen. Petrus went to TLM and proposed a loan of IDR 3,000,000. He would like to buy kiosk stocks such as soap, cooking oil, instant noodles, coffee, tea, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.use: to buy kiosk stock items such as soap, cooking oil, instant noodles, coffee, tea, sugar, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 54-years-old. She is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Zenaida has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like pants, towels, blankets, caps and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Zenaida has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, towels, blankets, caps and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Isata is 40 years old, and married with three children aged 5, 17 and 21.  She lives with her family and also a younger sister whom Isata is helping with her schooling. 

In 2005, Isata set up a business selling plastic wares such as bowls, spoons and dishes. She started the business because she wanted to bring additional income into the household to pay for the education of her children. Her business is in the city center, and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le1,500,000 every month from her business. She would like a loan for Le4,000,000. Isata needs a loan to buy more goods for resale. 

Isata hopes that this loan will her help to improve the business by getting more stock. In the future, Isata wants to expand her business to the outskirt of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic dishes

loans.name: Francess

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Francess. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 16 years. In 2010, Francess established her cosmetics, beads, hair and hair products business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband with the home affairs. Her business is located in the outskirts of the town, and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 550,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,500,000 Le. She has repaid two loans. Francess requires a loan in order to purchase more goods for resale. She hopes that this loan will help to improve the business by getting more stock. In the future, Francess plans to expand her business to the center of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 13 years. In 2005, Fatmata established her Patented Drugs business. She began her business, because she wants to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are lactating mothers and pregnant women. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 622,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more drugs for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the stock, and also the profit, of her store. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand in other places. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drugs for her pharmacy store

loans.name: Federica

texts.en:
Federica is 37 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business, making and selling native mats, in the Philippines. Federica requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF, to buy materials needed to make native mats.

Federica has been in this business for four years. Federica would like to save enough money in the future, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to weave native mats.
